catalogue.name: Ankle Unit
catalogue.tagline: Stabilises ankle/foot in neutral angle
catalogue.description: The LivPrint Ankle Unit is designed to immobilise the ankle and foot in a neutral position for injury management and post-operative care. It features a tough, lightweight construction that allows full weight bearing, adjustable straps to accommodate swelling, and an anti-slip sole for safe ambulation. The same unit can be used for both left and right foot, making it versatile and easy to prescribe.

catalogue.name: Ankle Stabiliser
catalogue.tagline: Stabilises the foot in post-op, sprain and ligament injury cases
catalogue.description: The LivPrint Ankle Stabiliser is a lightweight ankle support designed to control unwanted foot motion during post-operative recovery, sprains, and ligament injuries. Featuring R.O.M. clips for mobility control, medial and lateral support to prevent foot twist, and a cuff that snaps securely onto any shoe from both sides, it offers effective stabilization without restricting daily activity.

catalogue.name: Wrist Short
catalogue.tagline: Keeps wrist immobilised in neutral position & all metacarpals free
catalogue.description: The LivPrint Wrist Short is designed to immobilise the wrist in a neutral position while keeping all metacarpals free. Suitable for paediatric to adult patients, it offers rigid support with a compact profile. The brace is made from hypoallergenic, water-resistant materials and features adjustable fastening to accommodate swelling, making it ideal for prolonged clinical use.

catalogue.name: Ventral Wrist (Till M.C.P.)
catalogue.tagline: Keeps wrist stabilised in neutral position / 1st–5th metacarpals free
catalogue.description: The LivPrint Ventral Wrist (Till M.C.P.) brace is designed to stabilise the wrist in a neutral position while allowing free movement of the 1st to 5th metacarpals. Extending till the MCP joints, it provides controlled wrist immobilisation with a ventral support profile. Suitable for paediatric to adult patients, the brace features adjustable fastening to accommodate swelling and is constructed for durable, long-term clinical use.

catalogue.name: Wrist Rotor
catalogue.tagline: Locks the wrist at multiple angles / guided mobility
catalogue.description: The LivPrint Wrist Rotor is an advanced wrist orthosis featuring a mechanical rotor that allows the wearer to lock the wrist at a desired angle or maintain controlled guided motion. The design includes padded straps for a snug and secure fit, a thumb section restricted at neutral position, and a robust construction suitable for long-term clinical use. Available in 10 sizes from paediatric to adult, it adapts to swelling while maintaining consistent wrist control.

catalogue.name: Forearm Long
catalogue.tagline: Keeps wrist immobilised in neutral position & all metacarpals free
catalogue.description: The LivPrint Forearm Long is a rigid forearm and wrist orthosis designed to immobilise the wrist in a neutral position while keeping all metacarpals free. Its extended forearm length provides enhanced stabilization and load distribution, making it suitable for post-operative care, fractures, and severe wrist injuries. Constructed with water-resistant, hypoallergenic, and imaging-compatible materials, the device adjusts with swelling and offers durable long-term support. Available in 10 sizes from paediatric to adult.

The design allows the 2nd to 5th metacarpals to remain free, supporting functional hand movement during recovery.

catalogue.name: Cock-Up Unit
catalogue.tagline: Keeps wrist immobilised in neutral position with metacarpals free
catalogue.description: The LP-08 Cock-Up Unit is a specialized orthotic designed to keep the wrist immobilized in a neutral position while ensuring all metacarpals remain free and unrestricted. It features breathable openings for ventilation and water dissipation, a tough construction, and an ambidextrous fit with a dedicated left thumb opening.

catalogue.name: Exo Slab
catalogue.tagline: Tough base for plastering & bandaging
catalogue.description: The LP-12 Exo Slab is an ultra-lightweight orthotic base designed to provide a tough, reliable structure for plastering and bandaging applications. Weighing only 10-25 grams, it offers a minimalist yet durable reinforcement layer that integrates seamlessly with traditional casting materials.

catalogue.name: Ventral W/T (Till D.I.P.) (P.O.S.I.)
catalogue.tagline: Keeps wrist stabilised in neutral position / 1st-5th metacarpals immobilised in P.O.S.I.
catalogue.description: The LP-18 is a Position of Safe Immobilization (P.O.S.I.) unit designed to extend until the DIP joints. This specialized orthosis maintains the wrist in a neutral position while immobilizing all five metacarpals with the MCP joints held in 70°-80° of flexion to prevent ligament shortening and joint stiffness.

catalogue.tagline: Keeps wrist free while immobilizing 2nd–5th metacarpals with thumb in neutral position
catalogue.description: The Palm W/T Unit (Till D.I.P) is designed to allow complete freedom of the wrist while providing rigid immobilization of the 2nd to 5th metacarpals. Extending till the DIP joints, it ensures controlled finger positioning and maintains the thumb in a neutral, immobilized state. This orthosis is well-suited for fracture management, post-operative stabilization, and functional hand positioning where wrist mobility must be preserved.

The wrap-around radial-side design supports the central metacarpals and thumb in neutral position with multiple strap points for secure, adjustable stabilisation during fracture management and soft-tissue injuries.

catalogue.name: THUMB SPICA
catalogue.tagline: Keeps wrist free / thumb in neutral position / 2nd-5th metacarpals free
catalogue.description: A low-profile thumb spica orthosis that immobilises the thumb in a neutral functional position while keeping the wrist and 2nd-5th metacarpals free. The contoured shell and adjustable strap design provide targeted support for thumb injuries without restricting overall hand function.

catalogue.name: SHAFT SPLINT
catalogue.tagline: Stabilises metacarpal base and ‘gutter’ side of the hand
catalogue.description: A forearm-based shaft splint designed to stabilise the metacarpal bases and gutter side of the hand while allowing functional finger use. The perforated shell provides breathable coverage and padded straps ensure a snug, adjustable fit, with the option to keep the thumb free or locked as required.

catalogue.name: PALM SPLINT (TILL M.C.P)
catalogue.tagline: Keeps wrist free / 1st-5th metacarpals free
catalogue.description: A compact palm splint that extends till the MCP joints while keeping the wrist and 1st-5th metacarpals free. The contoured design supports the proximal palm just before the MCP level, providing comfort and protection without restricting finger or wrist movement.

catalogue.name: Static Elbow
catalogue.tagline: Modular Adjustable. LONG and SHORT.
catalogue.description: The LP-43 Static Elbow unit is a highly adaptable modular system designed for elbow stabilization. It can be configured into 'Long' or 'Short' versions to suit specific clinical requirements. The design includes integrated slots for strapping or taping and features an optional extension accessory to provide additional support to the wrist and palm areas.

catalogue.name: Rotor Elbow
catalogue.tagline: Lockable + R.O.M + Length-Adjustable
catalogue.description: The LP-44 Rotor Elbow is a sophisticated stabilization device featuring a lockable Range of Motion (R.O.M.) rotor. This length-adjustable unit provides guided articulation, allowing the rotor to be locked at any specific angle to meet clinical requirements while ensuring the elbow remains supported through a controlled recovery process.

catalogue.name: Full-Arm Unit
catalogue.tagline: Immobilises the elbow + forearm + wrist
catalogue.description: The LP-45 Full-Arm Unit is a highly modular orthotic solution designed for comprehensive upper limb stabilization. It features 360° modularity with a lockable rotor at every 10°, allowing for precise guided articulation or complete immobilization of the elbow. The unit is fully adjustable, with customizable bicep height and forearm length to meet specific wearer specifications.
